intro: Terminalia catappoides, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring, followed by round, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features make it an ornamental plant valued for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits. It is also used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
